channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Colbert canceled by CBS days after his withering criticism of parent company’s Trump settlement

item.title: Federal Workers Are Being Held Accountable For The First Time, And They’re Not Handling It Well
item.description: Obnoxious and entitled federal bureaucrats' attempts to resist reform are making it hard to say good things about public service.

item.title: Top 10 Most Read Blogs from Q2: AI, Alpha, and a Shifting Global Order
item.description: AI disruption, portfolio shifts, and timeless lessons—these blogs topped the charts in Q2.

item.title: Book Review: The Behavioral Portfolio
item.description: Phillip Toews challenges traditional portfolio construction, helping advisors build resilient strategies and coach clients through risk and bias.

item.title: Rethinking Research: Private GPTs for Investment Analysis
item.description: This chatbot-style tool allows investment analysts to query complex research materials in plain language without ever exposing sensitive data.

item.title: Mind the Inflation Gap: Hedging with Real Assets
item.description: Timely insights on portfolio risk, inflation hedging, and market cycles—grounded in financial history and written for investment decision-makers.

item.title: Book Review: Cheaper Faster Better: How We’ll Win the Climate War
item.description: Can capitalism save the planet? Tom Steyer makes the case in this urgent, optimistic roadmap to a net-zero future.
